clues.text: The Wilson brothers, Mike Love & Al Jardine, surfin' over '60s high notes
"Don't Lie"--will.i.am, apl.de.ap, Taboo & Fergie totally hip-hopped through the 2000s
Here come Annie Lennox & Dave Stewart again, falling on your heads like an '80s memory
Thomas Bangalter & Guy-Manuel de Homem-Christo, giving robot-ic performances in the 2010s
Last name, nickname, last name of Ricky, Michael, Ronnie, the R&B trio who dripped "Poison" in the '90s
Macropus giganteus, the eastern grey type of this marsupial, can cover 30 feet in a single bound
Won by the Toronto Argonauts in 2022, this championship trophy of the Canadian Football League was first awarded in 1909
This mustachioed fictional detective relied on his "little grey cells" to solve mysteries
Known for Old West novels, Zane Grey died in 1939, the year he published an "Epic of a Single Strand of Wire" about this company
The daughter of the Duke of Suffolk, she was only 15 when she ascended the throne

Archduke Franz Ferdinand, not that the event affected the entire world or anything
Niels Bohr, quantum leaping in 1962
Suddenly ex-president for life Papa Doc Duvalier
August Strindberg, going way heavy on the drama in 1912

rounds.category: WHO'S WHO IN THE OLD TESTAMENT

clues.text: This long-liver was the grandfather of Noah
For helping 2 of Joshua's spies, Rahab & her family were spared when Joshua captured this city
Following this king's death, David laments, "The beauty of Israel is slain upon thy high places: how are the mighty fallen!"
Armed with trumpets & torches inside jars or pitchers, he led an army of 300 in victory over the Midianites
When Sarah thought she was unable to give Abraham children, she gave him this handmaid, who bore Ishmael
In 2023 Kevin Costner wrangled a Golden Globe Award for his role as John Dutton on this series
Lester Holt is the principal anchor for this NBC newsmagazine & Andrea Canning & Keith Morrison are correspondents
The original of this series focused on Kevin Arnold; in the reboot, it's an African-American youth named Dean Williams
John Amos played the father on this '70s sitcom until he was killed off & J.J. became the man of the house
As a teen, Claire Danes starred as Angela Chase in this series about the trials & tribulations of being a teen
The Washington Post, November 10, 1989: "East Germany opens" this "and borders"
The Tampa Tribune, May 24, 1934: this pair "die with hands clutching guns"
The Oregonian, May 19, 1980: "Eruption decapitates" this peak
This U.S. city's Free Press, November 7, 1973: "Young elected city's first Black mayor"
The San Francisco Chronicle, October 11, 1973: this man from Maryland "resigns"
Through a conservation center in New York, you can observe critically endangered red & Mexican gray ones of these
Opened in 1919, this iconic golf course on the Monterey Peninsula offers stunning views of the 17th & 18th holes
A webcam on Sicily allows you to monitor the activity of this highest active volcano in Europe
From a webcam in Finland, you can see this nighttime phenomenon that's dependent on a strong solar wind
You can see people praying day & night at this holy site that was a part of a structure surrounding the Temple of Jerusalem
"Into Thin Air" was Jon Krakauer's personal account of a disaster during a summit attempt of this mountain
This Darwin work is subtitled "The Preservation of Favoured Races in the Struggle for Life"
Dee Brown told how the expansion of the American West caused the slaughter of indigenous people in "Bury My Heart at" this place
From his "Art of War": "The best victory is when the opponent surrenders of its own accord before there are any actual hostilities"
"A Natural History of Four Meals" is the subtitle of this eater's "Dilemma" by Michael Pollan
In a 2017 smash, Post Malone sang, "I feel just like a" this, which he is--he didn't mean he wanted an energy drink
An Ariana Grande song has this 3-letter title, an abbreviation for a phase of sleep
A Taylor Swift song says, "Loving him was" this, "burning" this
In a 2010 No. 1, P!nk instructed do this "if you are wrong in all the right ways"
This appropriately titled Blondie song was the first Billboard No. 1 hit with a rap verse
There's a mollusk in this phrase meaning to become suddenly silent
It's near the top of a ship's mast
A call at a frequency inaudible to humans, or a political statement with a hidden secondary meaning
This term for something impossibly rare predated the 1600s discovery of the real thing, Cygnus atratus, in Australia
"Un  éléphant dans un magasin de porcelaine" is the French equivalent of this expression featuring a different big animal

clues.text: World's smallest country in area & part of world's largest are on this continent
After Antarctica, this continent has the fewest nations
After Mt. Everest, the next 60 highest mountain peaks in the world are on this continent
Continent you'd be on if you were picnicking on the Pampa
Continent which is home to the fabled Berber horsemen
The Pied Piper's tune lured the children from this town
According to the World Book, "The Tale of Peter Rabbit" was the 1st modern children's book with these
French children's classic about an elephant who runs away from the jungle to live in Paris
In 1856, M.E.M. Dodge broke the ice with this 1st major American novel about life in another country
1 of 2 best-known awards in U.S. established by Frederick Melcher for children's literature
